summary: Add three new client methods for signal-with-start and update-with-start workflows in Ruby SDK, aligning with the design pattern used in Python and .NET SDKs. This includes signal_with_start_workflow, start_update_with_start_workflow, and execute_update_with_start_workflow methods.
userImpact: Users can now signal or update workflows at the time of starting them, providing feature parity with Python and .NET SDKs.
proposedFix: Implement three new methods on the client: signal_with_start_workflow, start_update_with_start_workflow, and execute_update_with_start_workflow, all accepting WithStartWorkflowOperation parameter.
resolutionDetails: Feature was implemented to achieve API parity with Python and .NET SDKs for signal-with-start and update-with-start operations.
keyQuote: We need the following methods on client: signal_with_start_workflow, start_update_with_start_workflow, execute_update_with_start_workflow
